column4: pl give me what is the command for update in terminal hezzman
is it sudo apt update
it's: sudo apt-get update
:) just add the pub_key
:) one moment, please, I'm searching the good command for you :)
baack !
just type in a term the command: $ gpg --recv-key 58403026387EE263 && gpg --export --armor 58403026387EE263 | sudo apt-key add -
open a term, please :)
:) the command is in two parts :). 1st: gpg --recv-key 58403026387EE263
:) and 2nd: gpg --export --armor 58403026387EE263 | sudo apt-key add -
^^ that's all! have fun. (don't forget the "-" at the end of the 2nd command :))
:p so, all is ok?
sure : here the command: sudo apt-get update
are you sure that your connexion is good?
just try another once
tell me what the result is :)
;) it's good, pretty good!
no, it's the good trick with linux, you needn't restart your computer :)
another command: for a upgrade of your system, the command (magical) is: sudo apt-get dist-upgrade -y
generally, I use this: sudo su -c "apt-get update; apt-get -y --force-yes dist-upgrade" && sudo -k
;) term is very powerful!
You can control your softwares very finely
